result.execSummary:
The defendant Demario C Adams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-False Representation >$2500-$5000, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Apply cash bail. Remainder to be paid at the rate of $100.00 per month commencing 5/1/19, and each month thereafter until paid in full, or 90 days jail as penalty for non-payment. 
Payable to the Waukesha County District Attorney's Office as follows: $8,918.08 to Trident Sales & Services; $1,940.00 to Siege Paintball; $400.00 to the Waukesha County District Attorney's Office. Restitution to be paid before costs.

Costs to be paid along with restitution. 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

(Apply 12 Days Credit)
First 8 MONTHS - STRAIGHT TIME
Last 4 MONTHS - HUBER, with release for work and/or treatment.
Defendant to report to the Waukesha County Jail by 1:00 p.m. on 5/8/18.
06/19/2018 COURT GRANTS REQUEST FOR GOOD TIME CREDIT TO ALSO APPLY TO THE STRAIGHT TIME PORTION OF SENTENCE.

AS OF 6/10/20: Court will WAIVE the last 25 dyas of the defendant's sentence. TIME SERVED

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Demario C Adams

records.addlTxt: 02:11 PM Defendant Demario C Adams in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Cooper Warner appeared by Zoom video for the State of Wisconsin.  Demario C Adams appeared by Zoom video means with Attorney who also appeared by Zoom video.  The parties agreed to have the hearing conducted remotely under the Standing COVID-19 Order requirements. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Case called for hearing to address status of the defendant returning to serve the remainder of his sentence at the Huber facility.  Ms. Warner presents statements and the State objects to the court staying the remainder of the defendant's sentence.  Atty. Menden is asking the court to stay the remainder of the defendant's sentence and presents additional statements.  Defendant presents statements.  Court reviews the sentence on the record and confirms with the defendant what portions of the sentence he has already served.  Court questions the status of payment of restitution.  Defendant advises that he is making monthly payments.  For reasons placed on the record the Court will waive the last 25 Days of the defendant's sentence and order Time Served.  Court to prepare an amended JOC.
Status hearing on June 10, 2020 at 02:00 pm.
Review hearing on March 30, 2020 at 09:30 am.

01:34 PM Attorney Eryn M Menden in court.   Defendant Demario C Adams did not appear.   Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for status of defendant returning to serve the remainder of his sentence at Huber.  Atty. Menden advises that the defendant is back in the hospital which is why he was not able to appear today.  Court will waive the defendant's appearance for today.  Atty. Menden advises the court of the status of the defendant being able to return to serve the remainder of his sentence.  Atty. Menden is requesting another review hearing in about 30 days.  Court adjourns for review hearing.  Court will allow the defendant to appear by phone for the next court date if needed.  Review hearing scheduled for March 30, 2020 at 09:30 am.
Review hearing on February 6, 2020 at 01:30 pm.
Review hearing on January 13, 2020 at 02:00 pm.

10:15 AM Defendant Demario C Adams in court by telephone with attorney Eryn M Menden.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern John Wagner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for status of defendant being able to return to complete the remainder of his Huber sentence.  Atty. Menden provides the court of the update of the defendant's medical condition; she is requesting another status in January.  Court adjourns for continued status in January.  Atty. Menden is requesting, if possible, that the court could order community service in lieu of the remaining Huber time.  Court advises that Atty. Menden will have to submit a formal proposal to the court with a copy ot the State before she would consider it.  Review hearing scheduled for January 13, 2020 at 02:00 pm.
Review hearing on October 31, 2019 at 10:00 am.

09:37 AM Defendant Demario C Adams in court by telephone with attorney Eryn M Menden.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern John Crawford appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for review and status with regards to the defendant returning to serve out the remainder of his Huber sentence.  Atty. Menden advises the court of the status of the defendant's recovery and advises he has therapy through October.  Court questions whether or not the defendant could serve out the remainder of his sentence in Cook County Illinois.  Atty. Menden advises he cannot and is asking the court to permanately stay the remainder of the defendant's sentence.  Court denies the request.  Court will adjourn for another review hearing at the end of October/beginning of November.  Defendant to appear by phone for the next hearing.  Review hearing scheduled for October 31, 2019 at 10:00 am.
Review hearing on September 12, 2019 at 09:30 am.

10:51 AM Defendant Demario C Adams in court by telephone with attorney Eryn M Menden.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern John Crawford appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for review as to status of when the defendant can return to serve the remainder of his Huber sentence.  Court reviews the case on the record.  Atty. Menden provides the court with an update on the defendant's medical condition and is asking the court to permanently stay the remaining Huber sentence.  Court will not grant the request to stay the remaining Huber sentence permanently and will adjourn for further review of the defendant's medical condition in about 60 days.  Court will allow the defendant to appear by phone for the next court date.  Review hearing scheduled for September 12, 2019 at 09:30 am.
Review hearing on July 11, 2019 at 10:30 am.

10:18 AM Defendant Demario C Adams in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called to address status of defendant's medical condition and when he can return to Huber to serve out the remainder of his sentence.  Atty. Menden is requesting that the Court permanently stay the remainder of the defendant's sentence, 1 month and 25 days, and presents arguments.  State objects and presents statements.  Defendant presents statements.  Atty. Menden provides an update with regards to defendant's injury.  Court will not grant the request to waive the remainder of the defendant's Huber sentence at this time but will adjourn for another further proceedings date in about 60 days.  Court will continue to stay the remainder of the Huber sentence pending the next court date.  Atty. Menden is requesting that the defendant's appearance be waived for the next court date.  Court will allow the defendant to appear by phone for the next court date.  Review hearing scheduled for July 11, 2019 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on May 1, 2019 at 10:00 am.

10:14 AM Defendant Demario C Adams in court with attorney Mark Rudy for attorney Eryn M Menden.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for status with regards to defendant's recovery and return to serve remainder of sentence at Huber.  Atty. Rudy presents statements and is requesting the stay be extended another additional 90 days and set for review.  State has no objection to the request.  Court will grant the request and continue the stay of the Huber sentence until further order of the Court.  Court will order that defense counsel provide a written update as to the current status of the defendant's medical condition by 03/20/2019.  Check Case scheduled for March 21, 2019.

Dated 10/26/2018 filed by Atty. Menden requesting that the remainder of the defendant's sentence be stayed.  **Defendant's sentence for time in the Huber facility is currently stayed to allow for his surgery and recovery.  The Court will set a status date to review his condition and determine when he will be able to complete the remainder of his sentence **
Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 6/24/18.

Dated 5/25/18 from attorney Menden requesting that the good time credit be applied to the straight time portion of the sentence.

06/15/18 - Court Reviewed - Request Granted - Amended JOC to be prepared - Good Time Credit will be applied to the Straight-Time portion of the sentence.

Defendant Demario C Adams in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court addresses PSI. Defense has no amendments to PSI. 
State makes sentencing arguments. Defense makes sentencing arguments. Defendant makes statement.


The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED SENTENCE of: 

(CREDIT - 12 days) 1 Year Jail
First 8 Months - STRAIGHT TIME
Last 4 Months HUBER with release for work and/or treatment.
Defendant to report to jail on 5/8/2018 by 1:00 p.m.
  


RESTITUTION:  $11,258.08 (Apply cash bail. Balance be paid restitution to be paid before costs or fines);
$8,918.08 Trident Sales & Services, $1,940.00 Siege Paintball, and $400.00 to Waukesha District Attorney's Office for extradition costs.
Restitution to be paid at the rate of $100 per month commencing 5/1/19, and each month thereafter until paid in full, or 90 Days jail as penalty for non-payment.

COURT COSTS:  $278.00 
Costs to be paid along with payment plan stated in restitution.

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00;
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Defendant Demario C Adams in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court conducts plea colloquy.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 2.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Counts 1 and 3 are dismissed and read-in.  Defense requests a PSI report be done.  PSI report is to be filed by 4-13-18.  Court grants.
